what: Setting up a new active engine
title: Introduction to knitractive
code: ```{r setup, include = FALSE} library(knitractive)  engine <- ActiveEngine$new(   name = "python",   shell_command = "docker run -it continuumio/anaconda3 python3",   prompt = "^(>>>|\\.\\.\\.)$",   lexer = "pycon", ) engine$start() ```

title: Authors and Citation
text: Janssens J (2024). knitractive: knitr engine simulate interactive sessions. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/jeroenjanssens/knitractive.
code: @Manual{,   title = {knitractive: A knitr engine to simulate interactive sessions},   author = {Jeroen Janssens},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/jeroenjanssens/knitractive}, }

title: A knitr engine to simulate interactive sessions
text: knitractive package provides knitr engine allows simulate interactive sessions (e.g., Python console, Bash shell) across multiple code chunks. Interactive sessions run inside tmux session tmuxr rexpect packages.

title: A knitr engine to simulate interactive sessions
A knitr engine to simulate interactive sessions
Class providing ActiveEngine object. — ActiveEngine
text: Class providing ActiveEngine object. Class providing ActiveEngine object.

title: Class providing ActiveEngine object. — ActiveEngine
code: ActiveEngine$new(   name,   command = "",   language = name,   prompt = NULL,   keep_session = FALSE,   session_width = 80,   session_height = 24 )
